column1: The Gate of Isengard was a strong gateway guarding the single arched tunnel in the wide rock-wall that surrounded Isengard and Orthanc. It lay in the southern part of Isengards defences
column2: approached by an ancient highway. At least in Sarumans time as master of Isengard
column4: though it was eventually thrown down by the invading Ents.

column2: Saruman had given his Gate special properties. Whether by some mechanism or spell
column3: he was able to project his famous voice through the Gate itself
column4: and so communicate with those outside his defences without putting himself at risk.
